mechanoreception.notes: Ticks in this family are parasitic and must detect hosts. The presence of the spinose ear tick (Otobius megnini) and other Otobius species suggests a reliance on mechanoreception for host detection, especially within the ear canal.

hygroreception.notes: Soft ticks are resistant to desiccation, implying a developed sense for detecting humidity gradients and avoiding dry environments.

chemoreception.notes: Ticks rely on chemical cues for host location. Given the parasitic lifestyle, chemoreception is likely used to detect host odors and locate feeding sites.
